2. Foetal lie and Presentation:
Determining the foetal lie and presentation is relevant only in late pregnancy (32 weeks onwards). Before that, it 
is important to only palpate the foetal parts while conducting an abdominal examination.
The normal lie at term in the majority of pregnancies is longitudinal, with a cephalic presentation. 
Any other lie is abnormal, and the woman must be referred to an FRU for the delivery.
